meanings.definition: Wawling (verb): to cry loudly and uncontrollably
meanings.sent1: The baby was wawling all night, keeping everyone awake.
meanings.sent2: She started wawling when she dropped her ice cream on the ground.
meanings.sent3: The wawling cat outside sounded like a sad opera singer.
meanings.sent4: Her wawling echoed through the empty hallway, a symphony of sorrow.
meanings.sent5: The wawling of the wind during the storm made the house feel haunted.

meanings.definition: Wawling (adjective): characterized by loud and uncontrollable crying
meanings.sent1: The wawling child in the store drew sympathetic looks from other shoppers.
meanings.sent2: The wawling puppy missed its owner and refused to eat.
meanings.sent3: The wawling alarm clock was the most annoying sound to wake up to.
meanings.sent4: The wawling sirens of the fire trucks pierced through the silent night.
meanings.sent5: The wawling thunderstorm outside made the whole house shake.
